availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin B. Scott (Green County, Kentucky, physician and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Kentucky, native. Son of John Scott and Ann Scott. Attended school in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Physician in Green County in 1860. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private and acting assistant surgeon from September 14, 1861, to July 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) to May 8, 1865. Surrendered in Clarke County, Georgia, on May 8, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on June 5, 1865.
